titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Muster roll of Colonel Benajah Strong's regiment 1973.194
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:12:06 +0000.

did.unittitle: Muster roll of Colonel Benajah Strong's regiment
did.abstract: The collection consists of a single bound volume containing the handwritten muster roll of Colonel Benajah Strong's infantry regiment of Lakeview, Long Island, New York, dated 1788. The muster roll features the names of officers in the regiment along with their ranks, and lists the regiment's individual companies with the first and last names of the members of each company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Muster roll of Colonel Benajah Strong's regiment, 1973.194, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
